intro: Hapalochilus alticola, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Hapalochilus alticola is adapted to harsh climates and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its mountainous habitat.
